## Bio

I am a PhD Candidate in the Bioinformatics and Systems Biology Graduate Program at UC San Diego and a National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellow. 
Before grad school, I spent ~5 years studying cancer drug resistance, where I worked primarily in the wet lab using genomics and CRISPR-based methods. 
Following my interest in somatic mutation outside of cancer, I have pivoted to neuroscience and bioinformatics
where I am developing methods in computational genomics to study the activity of retrotransposons in the mammalian brain. 

I enjoy working in collaborative, interdiscipliniary research groups to conceive and pursue research questions. 
I am also very passionate about taking reproducible, rigorous, and data-driven approaches to scientific discovery.

In my free time, I like to hike `r emo::ji("mountain")`, swim `r emo::ji("swimmer")`, and play tennis `r emo::ji("racquet")` all over San Diego County!
